DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this clinical study is to evaluate the operative performance of the PEAK PlasmaBlade® 4.0 during bilateral breast reduction; to monitor and record post-operative pain, adverse events and skin scarring following surgery; and to compare these outcomes to the HARMONIC SYNERGY® BLADE.
DOC.brief_title: Use of the PEAK PlasmaBlade 4.0 in Bilateral Breast Reduction
DOC.criteria: 1. Age between 18 and 70 2. Physically healthy, stable weight 3. No smoking <1 month prior to surgery and during study. 4. Desiring bilateral breast reduction 5. Subject must understand the nature of the procedure and provide written informed consent prior to the procedure. 6. Subject must be willing and able to comply with specified followup evaluations. 7. Female subjects must either be incapable of reproduction, or taking acceptable measures to prevent pregnancy and have a negative pregnancy test prior to participation in the study. 1. Age younger than 18 or greater than 70 years old 2. Anticoagulation therapy which cannot be discontinued 3. Smoking <1 month prior to surgery or during study 4. Infection (local or systemic) 5. Cognitive impairment or mental illness 6. Severe cardiopulmonary deficiencies 7. Known coagulopathy 8. Immunocompromised 9. Prior history of breast cancer 10. Kidney disease (any type) 11. Currently taking any medication known to affect healing 12. Subjects who are statuspost gastric banding or gastric bypass 13. Currently enrolled in another investigational device or drug trial 14. Unable to follow instructions or complete followup
